action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ X ▢ X ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X

DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square with the following pattern: In the first three rows, there is an "X" in the third column. In the fourth row, there are "X"s in the second and fourth columns. In the fifth row, there are "X"s in the first and fifth columns. All other cells are empty squares.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square with the following pattern: In the first three rows, there is an "X" in the third column. In the fourth row, there are "X"s in the second and fourth columns. In the fifth row, there are "X"s in the first and fifth columns. All other cells are empty squares.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any additional "X"s in your grid outside of the positions described in your description?

This is my DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square. The first three rows have an "X" in the third column. The fourth row has "X" in the second and fourth columns. The fifth row has "X" in the first and fifth columns. All other positions are empty squares.
QUESTION: Are there any additional "X"s in your grid outside of the positions described in your description? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the second or fourth columns of the first three rows in your grid?

ANSWER: No.

QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the first or fifth columns of the fourth row in your grid?

QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the first or fifth columns of the first three rows in your grid?

ANSWER: No.

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the third column of the fourth or fifth rows in your grid?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the third column of the fourth or fifth rows in your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.
